page.title: 09FARMING
page.content: {FARMS By Jeffrey and Niki. Farms round Bishops Nympton are big. Some farms have 80 acres and some 800 acres.Most farms keep beef cattle, dairy cattle and sheep.There are about 3,000 sheep around Bishops Nympton. The majority of farms do corn and silage. Most of the farms are 400 years old but some are 40 years old.Here's a bit from Niki. Mr.A.Bordens farm is in the middle of Bishops Nympton it is called Home Farm it has beef cows and sheep. The farm has 82 acres of land they only grow hay. Capital Farm belongs to Mr Woolacot it has 1,000 lambs and 700 ewes they have 8 tractors they grow corn and swedes they have 50 acres. The crops are used mainly to feed the animals but we also grow crops to feed ourselves, we grow turnips and swedes for ourselves.
